definition: extravagant (idiom); to throw away money by the handful/wasteful
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
variant of 角[jue2]/role

sentences.english: Xiao Zhimei served as the general manager of the high champion supermarket, wasteful spending.
sentences.chinese: 蕭芝媚擔任高爾佳超市的總經理後，大手大腳花錢。

sentences.english: EXAMPLE: During the heady years of great economic expansion, many people spent money recklessly.
sentences.chinese: 在經濟大擴張的急進年月，很多人花錢大手大腳。

sentences.english: A cavalier attitude to expenses incensed voters at home.
sentences.chinese: 他在花費支出上的大手大腳令全國選民爲之憤慨。

sentences.english: He is a playboy, and spends money hand-over-fist.
sentences.chinese: 他是個花花公子，花起錢來大手大腳慣了。

sentences.english: He contracted huge debts by rash spending.
sentences.chinese: 他由於大手大腳地花錢而負了大量的債。

sentences.english: I had a splurge and bought two new suits.
sentences.chinese: 我大手大腳花了一筆錢買了兩套新衣服。
她總是在購買服裝上大手大腳。

sentences.english: Randy's prodigal spending usually leaves him broke at the end of each month.
sentences.chinese: 蘭迪花錢大手大腳，所以他每逢月底常一毛不剩。

sentences.english: My daughter is too careless with money.
sentences.chinese: 我的女兒花錢總是大手大腳。

definition: to spend money recklessly/to squander
debt of gratitude
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to bite off more than one can chew (idiom)/to aim too high
it's the most capable people who do the most work (idiom) (intended as consolation for the overworked, or flattery when making a request etc)
lit. find a stage, put on a comedy (idiom); to join in the fun/to play along according to local conditions
to spend (money or time)
spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile
see 驢唇不對馬嘴|驴唇不对马嘴[lu:2 chun2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3]
pinyin: niu2 tou2 bu4 dui4 ma3 zui3

definition: sneering/sarcasm/cynical remarks
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
clean-living and honest (idiom); to avoid immorality/to shun evil influence/to mind one's own business and keep out of trouble/to keep one's hands clean
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
